entities.name: language extinction
entities.description: Language extinction, also known as language death, occurs when a language ceases to be spoken by a community, resulting in its loss as a living, functional means of communication. This phenomenon is complex and multifaceted, posing significant challenges to global linguistic diversity and cultural heritage.

attributes.Consequence: Erosion of traditional ecological knowledge, spiritual beliefs, and social structures
attributes.Impact: Loss of a unique way of understanding the world, expressing emotions, and preserving history

entities.name: cultural assimilation
entities.description: Cultural assimilation refers to the process by which a minority group or culture comes to resemble a dominant group or adopt the values, behaviors, and norms of another culture.

entities.name: globalization
entities.description: Globalization refers to the process by which businesses or other organizations develop international influence or start operating on an international scale.
